{ "Q": "What is the name of the technology that uses microbial constituents to enhance soil fertility and crop yield?",
  "A": "PUSA-Biofertilizer Technologies",
  "Q": "Which institutes developed the PUSA-Biofertilizer Technologies?",
  "A": "ICAR-IARI-PUSA",
  "Q": "What are the main microbial constituents used in the PUSA-Biofertilizer Technologies?",
  "A": "Rhizobium, Azotobacter, P-solubilizers, Azospirillum, Cyanobacteria, Mycorrhiza, Nitrogen Fixers, BGA (Blue Green Algae), Pseudomonas, Lactobacillus, Bacillus, and Vesicular Arbuscular Mycorrhizae",
  "Q": "What are the delivery systems used for the PUSA-Biofertilizer Technologies?",
  "A": "Seed coating, placement in furrows, machine spray, and broadcast in rice fields",
  "Q": "Are there any specific agroecological zones targeted by these technologies?",
  "A": "No, they can be used in all agroecological zones",
  "Q": "How have the PUSA-Biofertilizer Technologies been validated and commercialized?",
  "A": "They have been successfully validated in IARI and farmers' fields, and under AICRP trials. They have been commercialized and licensed to private companies through IARI-ZTM Unit",
  "Q": "What are the benefits of using PUSA-Biofertilizer Technologies?",
  "A": "They contribute 20-30 kg N/ha/season, increase crop yields by 8-25%, improve P uptake, and save 20-25 kg P2O5/ha. They also enhance soil health and augment K in a sustainable manner",
  "Q": "How many hectares of cultivated land have been covered by PUSA-Biofertilizers?",
  "A": "More than 10,000 ha",
  "Q": "What is the cost-benefit ratio of using PUSA-Biofertilizer Technologies?",
  "A": "1:3, taking Rs 6/ per kg as the minimum sale price" }

                            A: Through seed treatment, soil application in nursery and main field

                            A: Improved plant growth parameters, plant health, and yield; reduced soil-borne diseases incidence; important component in IPM strategy; eco-friendly and fits in organic farming concept

                            A: 40-60% wilt and root rot

{ "Q": "What is the primary goal of institutionalizing incentives, awards, and rewards in agriculture?",
  "A": "To encourage youth-led inclusive growth in agriculture by making it a more attractive profession." },

  "A": "To motivate and attract youth to engage in agriculture and allied fields by providing funding support and institutional mechanisms." },

  "A": "Long-term investments, easy and soft credit, upfront subsidies, farmer exchange visits, easy market accessibility, land law reforms, no taxation system, risk insurance, and reforms in marketing laws." },

  "A": "Through soft loans, mentoring programs, and involving rural youths as input dealers/suppliers and paid extension agents." },

  "A": "Create a separate Department of Youth in Agriculture under the MoA & FW to collaborate and coordinate with concerned line departments in other ministries." }
